sentences.en: China's WTO accession is the landmark of the beginning of all - round opening - up .
sentences.cn: 以加入WTO为标志,中国基本形成 全方位 的 对外开放 格局.

sentences.en: One of Belfast’s most famous landmarks, the Grosvenor Hall, has been demolished.
sentences.cn: 贝尔法斯特最著名的地标之一格罗夫纳大厦已被拆毁了。

sentences.en: The Ambassador Hotel is a Los Angeles landmark.

sentences.en: The city landmark system play a great role behind this Phenomenon.

sentences.en: The discovery of penicillin was a landmark in the history of medicine.
sentences.cn: 青霉素的发现是医药史上的里程碑。

sentences.en: The Empire State Building is a familiar landmark on the New York skyline.
sentences.cn: 帝国大厦是人们熟悉的纽约高楼大厦中的地标。

sentences.en: The local artists will hold an exhibition on the landmark.

sentences.en: There are efforts under way to designate the bridge a historic landmark.
sentences.cn: 人们正在努力将这座桥定为历史遗迹。

sentences.en: There are really two landmark papers just published areinformative in this regard.

sentences.en: This landmark case dispels the absolute finality of this dreaded disease.
sentences.cn: 这个划时代的病例终于改观了这可怕疾病的绝对结局.

sentences.en: To combat that attitude, Congress passed the landmark Voting Rights Act in 1965.
sentences.cn: 为了与这样的态度斗争, 国会于1965年通过了一项具有重大意义的选举权法案.

sentences.en: To the north, ELK Mountain is another well - known landmark, about 100 miles distant.
sentences.cn: 在北边, 埃尔克山脉是另一处著名的风光, 大约有100英里远.

trans.tran_en: something that is easy to recognize, such as a tall tree or building, and that helps you know where you are
